lines.text: [first lines]
[to a reporter who is cleaning his fingernails]
If you discover paydirt, let me know.
Let me see your license.
License? For what?
What are you peddlin' - snake oil or horse liniment?
Neither one. I'm peddlin' sunshine and joy... or trouble. Whatever the customer wants.
You better put a half-hitch on that lip of your'n before you get unpopular.
What's your business?
I haven't any. I'm just a rovin' cowboy.
[indicating Larry's dude ranch clothes]
In that rig you look more like a ramblin' rainbow.
What you say they call you?
Lucky Smith.
They call you "Lucky"?
Yeah
[laughs]
I got more luck than any two guys as ever got... and it's all bad.
Dr. Von Kurtz is an entomologist.
Oh, yeah? Where's your dummy!
Not a ventriloquist, an entomologist. Entomologist!
Ohhh... huh?
Ach, such stupidity! An entomologist is a scientist - a man that collects bugs.
Oh, that. Heh, I've been one for years and thought nothing of it.
Corpse? What corpse?
Her uncle was murdered.
Didn't I tell her that ruin and disaster would strike her down!
Maybe you had inside information.
[last lines]
[when the sheriff's deputy leads the beautiful Chinese women out of their hidden room, Lucky tries to follow]
Where do you think you're going?
Sheriff, can't I be deported, too? I think I'd like it in China.
[gazing at Barbara]
I know I like right here where I am.
